title: My portfolio
a-propos-text: Passionate about web development, I thrive on learning every day and transforming ideas into intuitive and functional interfaces. Curious and determined, I enthusiastically take on technical challenges, whether on the front-end or the back-end. Each project is an opportunity for me to progress, experiment, and perfect my skills. Discover my achievements and join me on my journey to becoming an accomplished developer!
passions-dev-text: I am passionate about creating innovative solutions and learning new technologies. Developing a project from A to Z or trying to replicate a mockup are things that stimulate me.
passions-lecture-text: I love exploring worlds through books, whether it's through the art of manga or literature. Discovering a new work is always a moment that brings me joy.
passions-musique-text: Music is a source of inspiration for me. I am very interested in the musical culture of many genres such as rap, pop, etc. I also master music composition using software like FL Studio.
passions-jv-text: Video games are a way for me to escape, but also an art form that explores endless universes. They are a big part of my childhood, and I love discovering new games of all kinds.
oc-text: I completed the "Web Developer" program at OpenClassrooms, a remote training program focused on hands-on learning. Guided by a mentor from the professional field, I worked on 8 practical projects, each designed to develop the technical and operational skills required in the workplace. This program, validated by an RNCP level 5 diploma (equivalent to a two-year degree), has provided me with a solid foundation to grow in the field of web development.
42-text: The 42 school's piscine is a unique 1-month experience where you learn the C language. It is a very enriching experience both technically and socially, as it pushes us to collaborate and learn quickly. The gamified system is a way to make programming cool and fun.
estiam-text: This first year of Bachelor's degree in a private school allowed me to develop general IT skills and understand what I liked in this field. I then decided to turn to schools like 42 and OpenClassrooms where the learning method is less academic.
uni-text: After high school, I started a degree in Computer Science / Economics, which I quickly dropped out of (university wasn't for me). However, it showed me that computer science was a field that interested me more than others. I spent the rest of the year working in a pizzeria while waiting for the next school year. üçï
jps-text: I was in high school in Bron from my sophomore to senior year. I chose Mathematics and Computer Science as my specialties and obtained my Baccalaureate diploma with honors.
recherche-entreprise-modal-title: I'm looking for a company for an apprenticeship or internship
mediatheque-text: I completed my 9th grade internship at the Chassieu Media Library. This was my first exposure to the working world. I had the opportunity to work at the library reception desk, shelve books, maintain the computer area, and participate in events for children and seniors.
super-paulette-text: While waiting to start at ESTIAM, I worked in the food service industry at Super Paulette in Villeurbanne. Through customer interactions, I developed many skills: taking orders, serving and handling payments, preparing pizzas, cleaning the restaurant, managing inventory, etc...
recherche-entreprise-text: If you're interested, you can contact me through the contact page!
react-description: Front-end development of dynamic and reactive interfaces.
node-description: Back-end development with the Express framework in Javascript.
next-description: High-performance web applications with server-side rendering.
sql-description: Relational database management language for structured data.
php-description: Server-side scripting language for dynamic web development.
